intro: Brassica juncea var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese mustard or Chinese mustard, is a cultivated variety of the mustard plant. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in racemes, which are followed by elongated, slender pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often grown for its seeds, which are used in cooking and traditional medicine. The plant is also valued for its ability to improve soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
